chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman Lascarez Antonio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant to obtain High School diploma.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Defendant to establish Family Court order. Defendant to pay outstanding ZCI fees. Services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Plea/sentencing hearing on March 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Roman Lascarez Antonio in court with attorney Jamie McClendon for Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Def - Req plea/sentencing date
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive at all.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780), exceptions are going to court, school, work and meeting w/his Atty.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. 
 **Amended 9-3-2014 to add school and work to GPS exceptions**
12/05/14 - BOND AMENDED: Defendant allowed to go to DMV for appointment on license. Also allowed out for job search on Friday afternoons from 3-6pm and Saturday mornings from 8am-noon. 
12/08/14 - BOND AMENDED: Defendant allowed to travel to visit his child while child is hospitalized at Advocate Lutheran Children's Hospital located at 1775 W. Dempster, Park Ridge, IL.
For Bond Modification - Defendant allowed to travel to visit child while hospitalized at Advocate Lutheran General Children's Hospital - 1775 W. Dempster, Park Ridge, IL.
